text: Detroit - Wayne County Community College District
How do I receive / accept aid?
Get where the world is going
Davenport University offers flexible, career-focused degree programs that help you earn the education, skills and real-world experience you need to rise above the rest.
More than a major. More than a degree.

At Davenport University, we aren't just concerned with helping you gain a degree; we are concerned with helping you gain a career. Our areas of study are built around degree programs that function as activity-based and hands-on training sessions. Choose your area of interest to see how we can help you achieve the future you're looking for.

At Davenport, our mission is to provide each and every one of our students with the means to pursue an education that will help them achieve the career of their choice. See what we can do for you by visiting the financial aid page.

With over 40  athletic teams and 40  clubs and organizations, we have something for everyone at Davenport. From our soccer team to the gaming club, you'll find your niche, in and out of the classroom.

Davenport offers 14 campuses across Michigan and an online campus that's available anywhere. Each of our locations has a unique environment and all provide the career-focused, success-oriented education you deserve.

Davenport is all about real-life experience. Our focus is on preparing you with the skills and knowledge that set you a part in the job market. See how this approach to learning helps our students and alumni thrive.

"I loved my DU experience. The instructors brought out the best of the students and set us up for success in the real world. The thing I enjoyed the most was the study abroad program. I studied in Europe and loved every moment of it!"
Bryan Holloway '16 MBA in Strategic Management
Works as controller of an Egg-o Plant
10 soft skills every job candidate should have in 2020
5 careers you can pursue with a lab science degree
Men’s D2 Hockey Vs. University of Louiville

Detroit - Wayne County Community College District
How do I receive / accept aid?

Here at Davenport, we are masters of searching high and low to help you build the best financial aid package possible so that starting at DU can be your reality. In addition to our general education and athletic scholarships, we offer 250  foundational scholarships through our generous donors. Between these scholarships, grants, and other financial aid options, Davenport can be affordable for you.
To begin your journey with us and take the next step, we invite you to

How do I receive / accept aid?
The First Step on the Road to Success
We are so excited that you are considering Davenport University as the place that you choose to continue your education.
Click the button below to begin your application and take the first step on your road to success.

If you have all the materials you need and are ready to apply to Davenport, click the button below to begin your application. Our application is broken up into multiple steps where you'll be able to save your progress, so if you don't have a lot of time, don't worry about finishing it in one session.
Want to learn more about the admissions process?
Please select an option below based on your status:
Request official high school or GED transcripts
NOTE- Davenport’s nursing programs require an additional, competitive
(Current High School student seeking early credit)
Review course options with DU admissions office
Complete dual enrollment registration forms with a high school counselor
NOTE- You must submit a new application and forms each semester
(First time in college with more than 2 years since High School)
Do you have a military background? We will personally review your individual situation for potential earned credits. Please
Have you attended college before? Select Transfer Student from the drop-down box.
(Attended college before, seeking an undergraduate program)
Apply your credits from previous colleges to complete your degree.
with admissions to determine next steps
Do you have a military background? We will personally review your individual situation for potential earned credits. Please
Move ahead with a graduate degree program from Davenport. Please visit the page for the degree you are pursuing to learn more about the admissions steps.
Complete application steps as outlined on the graduate
(International students and domestic international, on-campus and online)
We welcome you to explore Davenport from anywhere in the world. Join us and learn more!
Review the requirements for admission based on your personal situation
(Attending Davenport University for select classes only)
We welcome you to explore Davenport from anywhere in the world. Join us and learn more!
Review your educational goals with admissions to determine next steps.
Guest students may need to submit the
(for Michigan residents). Non-degree seeking students should work directly with admissions to select courses.
Welcome back! We are glad you’re considering returning to Davenport. No need to reapply for admission. Your next steps should be simple:
Contact the advising office to develop your personal plan for returning:
Submit transcripts from any college you have attended since leaving DU
Verify your re-entry status with your advisor to prepare for registration
You'll be asked for the following information, so please have it on hand when you begin:
Which semester you want to start classes: Fall (September & November), Winter (January & March), Spring (May & July).
Your personal contact information including Social Security Number for US Citizens.
Previous college, if applicable, and high school name. A lookup tool is provided.
International students - Visa type and dates if appropriate.
Which Davenport campus you're planning to attend.
Name of partner school or organization, if applicable.
